channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KY

item.title: Report X-2024030314
item.description:
Report X-2024030314

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Manager found package on trailer already leaking during unloading process, manager called QA to trailer. When admin arrived to spill package was put into a lined tote and spill pads were used to clean up leaked product. Package was then taken to hazmat cage to await further processing. DescribePack: Cap came loose during transport causing massive internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a lined tote.

item.title: Report X-2024030289
item.description:
Report X-2024030289

  • City: LOUISVILLE

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The cap on the bottle came loose and an internal leakage occurred. The item was brought to QA to be worked on. DescribePack: The box was leaking and staining was visible on the side. Once it was opened, the cap was noticed to be loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were placed in a spill tote to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report X-2024030297
item.description:
Report X-2024030297

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-05
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was on van line when it was found wet, after inspecting, one bottle of Isopropanol Alcohol was found with broken seal and cap completely off causing internal leakage. DescribePack: 1 gallon of 99% Isopropanol Alcohol, seal and cap came off. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Rough handling/ Cap may have already been loose before shipping and with liquid weight shifting, seal became damaged.

item.title: Report X-2024030339
item.description:
Report X-2024030339

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-14T18:15:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: PADUCAH
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found in the trailer laying sideways with the package orientation arrows facing sideways and the side of the box being wet. The hazmat package was put in a hazmat tote and brought to the QA cage for damage processing. DescribePack: The failure looks to have occurred with the cap on the bag which wound up leaking due to the package being loaded incorrectly into the trailer, which was from the package being laid on the side with the orientation arrows facing sideways instead of upwards. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat package was put in a hazmat tote lined with a hazmat bag.

item.title: Report X-2024030372
item.description:
Report X-2024030372

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-12T15:28:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking hazmat, when admin arrived package was already in a lined tote with a large puddle of product on the floor from where it had been leaking. Spill pads were used to clean up large quantity of spilled product then neutralizer was used over top of spill. After neutralizer sat for a minute it was swept up. DescribePack: Body of hard plastic bag inside of fiberboard box looked as if a side seam burst due to impact with the floor or another hard object. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was kept in a lined tote in an upright postion.

item.title: Report X-2024030143
item.description:
Report X-2024030143

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-11T15:13:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-06
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A WET PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH AND HAD A SMALL AMOUNT OF DRY ICE VAPOR COMING FROM THE BOTTOM CORNER OF THE BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY 40 LBS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING TWO BIOHAZARD BAGS CONTAINING SPECIMENS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX TO INDICATE DRY ICE WAS BEING SHIPPED IN THE AIR NETWORK. THERE IS A RUSH, PERISHABLE INSULATED STICKER AFFIXED TO ONE SIDE OF THE BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM MARYLAND USING THE CONSIGNEE UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER 442F01, AXIS CLINICALS, 1711 CENTER AVE W, DILWORTH MN 56529-1342.

item.title: Report X-2024030200
item.description:
Report X-2024030200

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-29
  • City: INDEPENDENCE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called to a leaking jerrican, when admin arrived jerrican was on rollerline to the side. Manager said when they moved it it splashed liquid out of it. No product was left to clean up due to it having evaportating before admin arrived to spill. Jerrican was put into a lined tote. DescribePack: When jerrican was inspected a small hole on the top of was discovered. Unsure how hole was created. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Jerrican was put into a lined tote and kept in an upright position to prevent further leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024030222
item.description:
Report E-2024030222

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-15
  • City: HORSE CAVE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ACTION RESOURCES, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Truck and trailer with hazardous waste load on a van trailer were in route. This load contained metal drums of waste flammable liquid. Driver stopped to take a break at a rest area in KY and discovered that there was a leak coming from the rear of the trailer. Local Fire Dept and Police were dispatched to the scene. An emergency response company was also retained and dispatched to the scene for response and clean up. For precaution the Fire Department evacuated the rest area. Upon investigation it was determined that one of the metal drums had been punctured and had leaked out inside the trailer and them some had leaked from the rear of the trailer onto the ground. The trailer was unloaded and decontaminated and the punctured drum was placed in an overpack and loaded back onto the trailer along with the other drums. The response crew also cleaned up the small amount that reached the ground. All waste was placed back on the trailer and transported to destination.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: QA was called due to a leaking hazmat, hazmat was immediately put into a lined tote when admin arrived to spill. Nuetralizer was used on spilled product, nuetralizer was cleaned up. DescribePack: Cap came loose on one bottle of product inside package causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tightend and package was kept in an upright postion in a lined tote to prevent further leakage.
